I think stopping the mob vote could be counterproductive in terms of added content in the future. I think the vote could be reorganized to please everyone.
The first step is to not eliminate mobs that lose, but rather add them in future updates. We players won't mind waiting a little longer if we are certain that the game content will improve significantly.
The second step is to understand that we players divide ourselves every time a vote of this style is made, because each one has their reasons for wanting the mobs we want to be added, and the pressure that the mob that loses will never see the light... It hurts. The community does not want bad vibes, but rather wants to enjoy a good game like Minecraft. If the mob that improves the build wins, those who have been asking for dog armor for years will become extremely frustrated with the game they have loved for years.
We don't want this for Minecraft. We don't want this for our game. We don't want a mob vote to divide us for another year. If Mojang does not eliminate the mob vote, please reconsider it, but this cannot continue the same.

I suggested this same thing.  They seem to have removed mine in favor of yours, so I will just put it here in case it helps.

is channel has 1,294,821,991 views and 10,600,000 subscribers.  10 million subscribers is a extremely difficult milestone to reach that few people ever reach.*

Something way more important than just numbers is character.  He is a good person.  He is perfect example of how a Minecraft community member should act, even by Minecraft's official guidelines.  I'm referring to Minecraft's Community Standards, Eula, and Terms and Conditions.  He has also raised/helped raise money charity, $346,507 for Sarcoma Foundation of America and $129,121 in the Minecrafters Vs Cancer [February 2022].

Technoblade was someone you could look up to, and I admired him.  Not for his skill in the games, although that is impressive, but for his character and his actions like the charity fundraising.  Despite his jokes, he wasn't someone who was always wanted to spotlight, but it seemed to find him.  Even in his final days, he was helping the people he cared about.  I wish I was able to tell him how much he meant to me, and I am hoping that this might make up for that fact.  It would mean a lot to his family, friends, and fans.

That's why I believe "Technoblade never dies." should be added as a splash text, and it is true.  He will live on though his videos, good deeds, friends, and fans.

*All statistics are from the time of writing June 30, 2022, 11:30PM CST.
